etymology.description: 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") + phonetic: 𠂆 (simplified to 孚(孚) (fú, "trust") = to carry valuables -> bear, suffer
etymology.interpretation: The character 負(負) (fù, "bear; suffer") combines 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry"), indicating something of value, with the phonetic component 𠂆, suggesting the act of carrying or bearing. Together, they convey the idea of carrying a burden or responsibility, aligning with the meanings of bearing or suffering.
etymology.simplification: In the simplified form 负(負), the 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") component was replaced with a simpler shape that resembles a trapezoid, reducing the number of strokes.

examples.chinese: 他毅然负起照顾家庭的责任(他毅然負起照顧家庭的責任)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yìrán fù qǐ zhàogù jiātíng de zérèn.
examples.english: He resolutely took on the responsibility of caring for his family.

examples.chinese: 困难来临时(困難來臨時)，他从不负众望(他從不負眾望)。
examples.pinyin: Kùnnan láilín shí, tā cóng bù fù zhòngwàng.
examples.english: When difficulties arise, he never disappoints everyone's expectations.
